result.execSummary:
The defendant Leticia M Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served. Court is not opposed to sentence being served in Brown County.
If revoked: Huber release privileges for work, school and childcare ONLY

miscConds.notes:
*   Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge;
*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including Domestic violence assessment and DNA surcharge by March 8, 2017. Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
*   No contact with victim Carmen M.

*   Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leticia M Sanchez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served. Court is not opposed to sentence being served in Brown County. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work, school and childcare ONLY:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of
          Correction.  This time is stayed to be used at the
          agent's discretion.
     *   Successfully complete "Anger Management".
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victim Carmen M.
     *   Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge;
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including Domestic
          violence assessment and DNA surcharge by March 8, 2017.
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry
          of a civil judgment.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
20 day appeal given,

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Angele Dentice in the Court to reschedule February 2, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31 on March 8, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Angele Dentice contacted the Court to reschedule January 12, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31 on February 3, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for status conference.
Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea/sentencing hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for status conference.  Defense counsel needs additional time to review records.  Defendant has childcare issue and mental health needs.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele Dentice in the Court requesting to reschedule September 23, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. for status conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference/possible projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37 on October 7, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.  Defense counsel just appointed and has received discovery and offer, additional time to review with her client.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Defense attorney Angele Dentice unavailable for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:; Carmen M; Jose M; Susana A; or their address.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Leticia M Sanchez in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
